refnamediv.refpurpose: Add an intervention resource onto a host or cluster

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The aq add_intervention command adds an intervention resource onto a host or a cluster. An intervention is a temporary modification of host configuration. The modifications available are currently limited to only modifying host login access, or disabling actions.

Adding a intervention onto a host or cluster adds a new entry into the configuration profile under /system/resources/intervention. How that resource gets used is down to the archetype and personality templates. For example, the standard linux templates will grab the intervention resources and use them to modify the login access lists and the startup actions. Please see the documentation on the personality and archetypes to see how they manage intervention resources.

refsection.title: Templates
refsection.para: This command will modify the templates for the host or cluster (depending on which option was given) and the resource template for the intervention itself.

listitem.para: Specify the target host for the intervention.
The name of the target cluster for the intervention.
Extra authorization tokens (e.g. change management reference ID) to with which the system can validate or correlate the request.
A name for the intervention. This is the internal name which must be unique for the specific host. The name must consist of only alphanumeric characters.
A date when the intervention should expire. The date format is anything that the python library dateutil.parser can understand.
A comma-separated list of usernames that should be allowed access to the host.
A comma-separated list of netgroups that should be allowed access to the host.

A comma-separated list of action names that should be disabled. For example, if there is a named action called "start-my-app" that is configured to run at host startup, then using --disable start-my-app will prevent that action from triggering when the host next reboots.

example.title: Allowing temporary access to a host
example.programlisting: aq add intervention --hostname foo.example.com \ --intervention njw-fix \ --justification tcm=6001234 --allowusers njw --expiry 1/1/2012
